texto: Widening and rehabilitation of several bridges over two existing railroads, five existing roads and two crossings of the Grand Calumet River, as well as a long bridge structure (the GTP Bridge) parallel to and partially overhanging the Grand Calumet River, which is described below.
Widening and rehabilitating the existing elevated roadway and an interchange with existing railroads on both sides. In order to allow the widening one of the railroads had to be realigned.

The original roadway in this section was a divided highway, mostly on fill, with two lanes in each direction and a grass median.  The new cross section consists of an urban (narrow) median with full width shoulders and three lanes per direction of traffic.
